snippet: Kirsan N. Ilyumzhinov held a three-hour meeting with Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, on Sunday, but it was unclear whether he was acting on his own or unofficially on Moscow’s behalf.
abstract: Kirsan N Ilyumzhinov, the president of the World Chess Federation, Russian millionaire who last year tried to negotiate a settlement in Libya’s civil war, visits Syria to meet with Pres Bashar al-Assad; though he holds no formal diplomatic position with the Russian government, his repeated visits to Arab countries in turmoil have reinforced the impression that he is serving as an informal envoy, using the chess organization’s business as a ruse.
lead_paragraph: Kirsan N. Ilyumzhinov held a three-hour meeting with Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, on Sunday, but it was unclear whether he was acting on his own or unofficially on Moscow’s behalf.

headline.seo: World Chess Federation Leader Visits Assad in Syria
headline.main: Chess Leader Visits Syria Under Cloud of Ambiguity
headline.print_headline: Chess Leader Visits Syria Under Cloud Of Ambiguity
